paper_abstract: A Chebyshev knot C(a, b, c, phi) is a knot which has a parametrization of the form x(t) = T(a)(t); y(t) = T(b)(t); z(t) = T(c)(t + phi). where a, b. c are integers, T(n)(t) is the Chebyshev polynomial of degree n and phi is an element of R. We show that any rational knot is a Chebyshev knot with a = 3 and also with a = 4. For every a, b,c integers (a = 3, 4 and a, b coprime), we describe an algorithm that gives all Chebyshev knots C(a, b, c, phi). We deduce the list of minimal Chebyshev representations of rational knots with 10 or fewer crossings. (C) 2010 Published by Elsevier Ltd
